stories.text: Our class is having an election for class president. This is an example of **democracy**, where we all get to vote. We are starting a **campaign** to tell everyone our ideas. Before the election, our teacher **appointed** Mia as the temporary leader. It's a big job. She has to help when things get **chaotic**, like when everyone is talking at once. Her main rule is to **confine** all running and shouting to the playground, not the classroom.

Hi Team, I know this first week at the new office was incredibly **chaotic**! Papers were everywhere, and the phones never stopped ringing. The company is in the middle of a huge new advertising **campaign**, so everyone is busy. I was **appointed** as the junior coordinator, which means I help organize you all. For now, please try to **confine** your questions to email so I can keep track. I promise this company is a great place to work; it has a strong feeling of **democracy**, and the boss actually listens to everyone's opinion.

The transition from a monarchy to a full **democracy** was not a smooth process for the nation. After the revolution, the new government **appointed** a special committee to write a constitution. However, their first goal was to **confine** the powers of the new leader, to ensure no single person could become a tyrant. The situation in the capital remained **chaotic** for months, with different groups fighting for control. To win public support, the interim leaders launched a massive information **campaign** to explain the benefits of the new system.

The mayor's latest urban renewal project has been criticized as being more of a publicity **campaign** than a genuine effort to help citizens. Critics argue that the project seems designed to **confine** the city's poorest residents to specific zones, rather than integrating them. The problems worsened when the mayor **appointed** a personal friend, who lacks experience, to oversee the budget. This has led to a **chaotic** allocation of resources, and the entire action fundamentally undermines the principles of social **democracy** that he claims to support.

Hey, are you okay? You seem **alienated** from everyone at lunch. You sat all alone. I have a strange **conception** of what might be wrongâ€”did you have a fight with Sam? I know he can be **combative** and likes to argue. He **demanded** that I choose a side, which isn't fair. How about we get a **combination** of snacks after school and talk?

My original **conception** of this recipe was that it would be very simple. I was wrong! This dish **demanded** much more attention than I expected. The flavor is a perfect **combination** of sweet and spicy. Be careful with the ginger, though. If you add too much, the taste becomes very strong and **combative**, almost fighting with the other spices. I don't want you to feel **alienated** from cooking, so I promise my next recipe will be much easier!

Our initial **conception** of the project was too ambitious. The client **demanded** a final product by next week, which was unrealistic. This impossible deadline created a tense, **combative** atmosphere in the office, with teams blaming each other. As a result, the design team felt completely **alienated** from the process and stopped sharing their ideas. The only path forward is a **combination** of a new timeline and better communication.

The protagonist's deeply **alienated** state is the engine of the novel. His entire **conception** of the world is shaped by his isolation. This alienation isn't passive; it's a **combative** stance against a society he feels has rejected him. The author skillfully **demanded** that the reader sit with this discomfort, offering no easy answers. The character is a complex **combination** of vulnerability and aggression, making him one of the most compelling figures in modern fiction.

Welcome to the School Pet Club! This is a friendly **association** for all animal lovers. We have a student **committee** that plans fun events. I want to **assure** you that all our pets are friendly. Sometimes our meetings get a little loud, but it's never total **chaos**. Our only rule is that we do not discuss **controversial** topics, like which pet is "better." We are all friends here.

The city is in complete **chaos** following the mayor's speech. The new policy is extremely **controversial**, and many people are angry. The mayor formed a special **committee** to review the policy, but citizens are not satisfied. A spokesperson tried to **assure** the public that their voices were being heard. However, the local citizens' **association** has already planned a large protest for this weekend.

To: All Staff, Re: New Partnership. I want to **assure** everyone that the new partnership with TechCorp will be good for us. I know the decision was **controversial**, but the executive **committee** voted unanimously in favor. This **association** will open up new markets for us. I understand there is some fear about job changes, which can create a feeling of **chaos**, but we have a clear plan for a smooth transition.

The historical **committee** reviewing the artifacts made a highly **controversial** decision to re-date the items. This decision has thrown the entire timeline of the period into **chaos**, effectively rewriting history. The evidence relies on a tenuous **association** between two previously unconnected sites. While the authors **assure** their readers that their methodology is sound, the academic community remains deeply divided over these radical claims.

When Dr. Elias Vance was **appointed** to the governing board of the Historical Integrity **Association**, he believed it to be the pinnacle of his career. This esteemed **committee**, a self-proclaimed bastion of academic **democracy**, was tasked with preserving the nationâ€™s founding narratives. However, Vanceâ€™s initial **conception** of the group as a body of objective scholars quickly dissolved. He found their work to be a strange **combination** of rigorous research and willful blindness to inconvenient truths. His nature was not passive; it was intellectually **combative**. He openly **demanded** a review of the societyâ€™s most cherished publications, labeling them as flawed. He soon found himself completely **alienated** from the inner circle. In response, Vance initiated what could only be described as an internal **campaign** for reform. The result was predictable: utter **chaos**. The established members tried to **confine** the damage, limiting his access to archives. The situation became so **chaotic** that the chairwoman had to intervene. She tried to **assure** the members that proper procedure would be followed, but the trust within the institution was already broken.

The police finally caught the **kidnappers** who took the rich man's son. They had to ask the **military** for help because the bad guys had big guns. This story was in the **headlines** of every newspaper today. The criminals were caught and **imprisoned** in a strong jail. Now, the city is safe and people can live in **harmony** again.

I just watched a great movie! It was all over the **headlines** last week. The story is about a group of **kidnappers** who steal a famous painting. The government sends a special **military** team to stop them. In the end, the bad guys are **imprisoned** for a long time. The final scene shows the hero returning home to live in **harmony** with his family. It was very exciting!

Achieving social **harmony** in this region has become increasingly difficult. The government has increased its **military** presence on the streets to maintain order. Many protesters claim they were falsely accused and **imprisoned** without a fair trial. The daily **headlines** are filled with stories of conflict and fear. Some rebel groups are even acting like **kidnappers**, taking civilians hostage to demand money from the state.

The sudden **military** coup shocked the international community. The democratically elected president was immediately **imprisoned** in an undisclosed location. Observers described the junta not as leaders, but as political **kidnappers** holding the nation's future ransom. These dramatic events dominated global **headlines** for weeks. The prospect of restoring domestic **harmony** seems distant, as the population remains deeply divided.

I read a sad book about the **cruelties** of hurting animals. It made me cry, but my mom said it is **permissible** to show feelings. The book **consists** of five true stories. It explains a strange **phenomenon**: why some people treat pets badly. I want to make a small **contribution** of money to help the animal shelter next week.

I believe that true happiness **consists** in helping others. It is a common **phenomenon** that giving makes you feel better than receiving. That is why I made a **contribution** to a charity yesterday. They work hard to stop the **cruelties** of child labor in factories. I asked the manager if it is **permissible** for me to bring my friends to volunteer next time, and she said yes!

Dr. Lee's major **contribution** to modern medicine was discovering a new vaccine. He often said that scientific success **consists** of 99% hard work and 1% luck. It is now **permissible** for other labs to use his data for research. He spent his life studying the **phenomenon** of how viruses spread rapidly. His goal was to end the **cruelties** of the disease that had caused so much suffering.

In a civilized society, we must constantly ask what actions are legally and morally **permissible** during times of conflict. True peace **consists** of justice and equality, not merely the absence of fighting. We cannot simply turn a blind eye to the **cruelties** suffered by refugees at our borders. Their potential **contribution** to our economy and culture is often overlooked. Mass displacement is a global **phenomenon** that requires a coordinated response.

My father works for a large **corporation** in the city. Yesterday, he brought home a new toy that was **designed** by his team. He gave it to me as a **token** of his love. It is a castle, and I used extra blocks to **fortify** the walls to make them strong. My sister thinks the castle is ugly, but I think beauty is **subjective**, so I don't mind her opinion.

Please accept this gift basket as a **token** of our appreciation. We know that taste in food is **subjective**, but we hope you find something you like inside. This special package was **designed** just for our VIP clients. We hope to **fortify** our relationship with you in the coming year. Our **corporation** is committed to providing you with the best service possible.

The new headquarters was **designed** to be the safest building in the city. The owner is a major global **corporation** that deals with sensitive data. They built thick walls to **fortify** the structure against any physical attacks. Critics argue about the building's aesthetics; some say it looks powerful, while others say it looks scary, proving that art is **subjective**. The company also built a public park nearby as a **token** of goodwill.

The general attempted to **fortify** the morale of his troops before the decisive battle. He argued that fear is a **subjective** emotion that can be mastered with discipline. The army was run like a ruthless **corporation**, prioritizing efficiency over individual welfare. The medal of honor was often seen as a mere **token** for the immense sacrifices soldiers made. The entire military campaign was **designed** not for defense, but to expand influence.

The annual charity gala hosted by the Zenith **corporation** was dominating the **headlines** for weeks. The event took place in a glass pavilion **designed** to symbolize transparency and global **harmony**. However, the evening's elegance was shattered by a shocking **phenomenon**: a sudden blackout followed by armed men. The wealthy guests found themselves effectively **imprisoned** within the ballroom. Outside, the police requested **military** support to **fortify** the perimeter. Inside, the leader of the intrudersâ€”identified later as political **kidnappers** who had seized the CEOâ€”began to speak. He passionately described the hidden **cruelties** inflicted by the company's factories. He argued that while their methods might not be legally **permissible**, they were morally necessary. He proclaimed that true accountability **consists** not in charity, but in transparency. The leader mocked the gala as a mere **token**, claiming it was a distraction rather than a genuine **contribution** to society. As the night wore on, the debate among the hostages regarding the intruders' morality became intensely **subjective**.

My dog, Max, thinks the entire garden is his **territory**. Whenever the mailman comes close to the gate, Max barks loudly. The poor mailman usually runs away in **terror**. I **consulted** a dog trainer about this problem yesterday. She said we need to **reform** Max's behavior with some training. I hope being strict won't **spoil** his happy personality, but he needs to learn.

Last month, I decided to **reform** my bad eating habits. I **consulted** a doctor to get some professional advice. He warned me that eating too much sugar would **spoil** my teeth and health. Going to the gym was new **territory** for me, and I felt nervous at first. To be honest, I had a feeling of **terror** when I saw the heavy weights, but now I love exercising.

The CEO made a sudden decision that threatened to **spoil** the company's reputation. He hadn't **consulted** the board of directors before acting. Many managers felt he was stepping on their **territory** and ignoring their authority. The news caused absolute **terror** among the investors. Now, the shareholders are demanding a plan to **reform** the management structure to prevent this from happening again.

The dictator's regime relied on psychological **terror** to suppress any opposition. He claimed that the neighboring province was historically his nation's **territory**. Although diplomats were **consulted**, peace talks quickly broke down. The aggressive military moves threatened to **spoil** years of diplomatic progress. International organizations are now pressuring the government to **reform** its foreign policy and respect human rights laws.

I saw two boys fighting in the schoolyard today. I hate **violence** because it scares me. I tried to **dodge** them so I wouldn't get hit. A teacher came to **solve** the problem and stop the fight. She told us that if we are kind, our school will **flourish** and be a happy place. It is hard to **withstand** bullying, but we must be brave.

I'm trying to grow roses in my garden, but the strong wind is a problem. I need to find a way to **solve** this issue. I planted a hedge to help the flowers **withstand** the storms. If I don't protect them, the **violence** of the wind will destroy the petals. I also have to **dodge** bees while I'm working! Hopefully, with my care, the roses will **flourish** this summer.

The young boxer managed to **withstand** a heavy blow in the first round. His opponent was known for his speed and ability to **dodge** punches effortlessly. However, the match was criticized for its excessive **violence**, which some say is bad for the sport. The boxing association is trying to **solve** this by introducing stricter safety rules. They believe that with better regulations, the sport will continue to **flourish** safely.

The nation's economy has shown a remarkable ability to **withstand** global recessions. However, the government cannot simply **dodge** the underlying issues of inequality forever. The recent outbreak of urban **violence** was a symptom of deep social unrest. To ensure that businesses continues to **flourish**, policymakers must address the root causes. There is no simple way to **solve** such complex structural problems.

There was a big **scandal** at school today. Someone stole the answers to the math test! I was the only **witness** who saw a boy running out of the teacher's office. The teacher was busy **supervising** the lunchroom at that time. The boy tried to **justify** his actions by saying he was stressed, but the principal said that stealing is wrong. He must face **justice** and accept his punishment.

I love watching the new TV show "Courtroom Drama." In the last episode, a lawyer tried to get **justice** for an innocent man. The man was accused of causing a financial **scandal** at his company. However, a surprise **witness** appeared and told the truth. It turned out his boss, who was **supervising** the accounts, stole the money. The boss couldn't **justify** why the funds were missing and went to jail.

As a manager **supervising** a large team, you must set a good example. Any hint of a **scandal** can ruin our department's reputation. Recently, we had to fire an employee for dishonesty. He tried to **justify** lying on his report, claiming everyone does it. However, we cannot ignore such behavior. To ensure **justice** for hardworking staff, we must be fair. If you **witness** any unethical actions, please report them immediately.

The senator's career ended in disgrace following the corruption **scandal**. For years, he had been responsible for **supervising** the allocation of public funds. Critics argue that he used his power to enrich his friends, unable to **justify** the exorbitant expenses. The public demanded **justice**, calling for a full investigation. A key **witness** has now come forward with documents that could permanently destroy the senator's legacy.

The task of **supervising** the International Tribunal fell to Chief Prosecutor Elena Vance. She was determined to **solve** the mystery behind the "Midnight Purge," an event that had instilled absolute **terror** in the populace for a decade. The defendant, ex-Minister Kael, attempted to **dodge** culpability during the cross-examination. He tried to **justify** his authorized use of state **violence**, arguing it was the only necessary evil to ensure the nation would **flourish** amidst the chaos. However, the trial took a dramatic turn when a massive **scandal** broke: leaked audio tapes proved Kael had treated the state treasury as his private **territory**, siphoning funds for personal gain. Furthermore, records showed he hadn't **consulted** the cabinet on military strikes. A key **witness**, Kael's own brother, testified that Kael deliberately plotted to **spoil** the peace treaty to prolong the conflict for profit. Kael's defense could not **withstand** the weight of the truth. The verdict sparkled a wave of relief, paving the way for institutional **reform**. It was a historic moment where the victims finally saw **justice** served.

I want to buy a new bike, but I have a very small **budget**. My mother told me to **evaluate** the prices in different shops first. I checked my **current** savings, and I do not have enough money yet. My brother works in a bike shop and gets a **commission** for every bike he sells. He is lucky and has a small **fortune** in his bank account.

When starting a new project, the first step is to set a clear **budget**. You need to **evaluate** all possible costs to avoid running out of money. Under the **current** economic conditions, prices are changing quickly. Some sales agents earn a high **commission**, which allows them to save a **fortune** over several years of hard work.

Financial experts often **evaluate** the market to give better advice to investors. In the **current** climate, it is difficult to maintain a strict **budget** due to unexpected inflation. Many people lost a **fortune** when the stock market dropped suddenly. However, those who earn a **commission** from high-value trades are still doing quite well.

The board of directors met to **evaluate** the company's performance over the last quarter. Given the **current** instability in global markets, they decided to slash the marketing **budget** for the next year. While the CEO has amassed a personal **fortune**, many employees are struggling. The new policy states that sales staff will receive a higher **commission** to encourage better results.

My uncle has a small **enterprise** that sells fruit. Last year, the old roof of his shop **collapsed** during a big storm. He had many **financial** problems after that. He had to travel to another country to find work, and he had to learn about their **currency**. Now, his **mission** is to save enough money to fix his shop.

Every big **enterprise** starts with a dream. The company's **mission** is to provide clean water to everyone. However, they faced **financial** trouble when a major bridge **collapsed** and blocked their trucks. They also had to deal with changes in the local **currency**, which made buying materials more expensive.

The global **enterprise** faced a crisis when its main factory **collapsed** in the earthquake. This led to serious **financial** instability for thousands of workers and their families. Management declared that their primary **mission** was to protect jobs. They also struggled with the falling value of the national **currency** against the dollar.

The failure of the private **enterprise** sent shockwaves through the entire industry. After the housing market **collapsed**, many banks faced a **financial** nightmare. Experts analyzed the impact on the global **currency** markets for several weeks. The government's **mission** was to restore public trust and prevent further economic damage to the country.

When you start a new school, you must follow the **code** of conduct. I saw a poster for a drawing **competition** yesterday. The prize is 500 dollars in **cash**. I want to join, but I need a **credible** teacher to sign my form. My father also had to sign a **contract** for his new job today.

It is important to be a **credible** person so that people can trust you. In business, there is always a lot of **competition** between different brands. Before you start working, you must read the **contract** carefully. Some shops only accept **cash**, while others follow a strict **code** for digital payments to keep things safe.

To stay ahead of the **competition**, a company must provide **credible** evidence that its products are the best. Every employee must sign a **contract** and agree to follow the company's ethical **code**. Although many people use credit cards now, some small businesses still prefer to be paid in **cash** to avoid bank fees.

The legal team reviewed the **contract** to ensure it was **credible** and legally binding. In a market with intense **competition**, companies often lower their prices to attract customers who pay in **cash**. However, all businesses must adhere to the professional **code** of ethics. Any violation could lead to a serious loss of reputation and trust.

The CEO of the massive **enterprise** was forced to **evaluate** the **current** situation after their latest venture **collapsed** unexpectedly. Facing a major **financial** crisis, the board demanded a new **budget** that would prioritize stability over rapid growth. The companyâ€™s **mission** was now simply to survive the fierce **competition** in the global tech sector. During the emergency meeting, a **credible** whistleblower revealed that some executives had been taking an illegal **commission** on every government **contract**. This was a clear violation of the corporate **code** of ethics. The news caused the company's market value to drop, wiping out a **fortune** for many long-term shareholders. To settle the immediate debts, the company had to pay a large amount of **cash** in local **currency**, leaving its future in doubt.

I got my first **wage** today! I spent some of it on **wholesale** candy to save money. I **invested** the rest in a small piggy bank. If the candy tastes bad, can I get a **refund**? My mom is helping me make a **financial** plan for next month.

Smart shopping means buying items at **wholesale** prices when possible. I **invested** in a membership card for a big store last year. If you aren't happy with a product, you can usually ask for a **refund**. Good **financial** habits start with managing your weekly **wage** carefully.

After receiving his monthly **wage**, Mark **invested** a portion in the stock market. He is very careful with his **financial** decisions and avoids buying things he doesn't need. However, he once had to fight for a **refund** after a computer he bought at a **wholesale** market stopped working.

Many people struggle to manage their **financial** future despite earning a decent **wage**. Some have **invested** heavily in real estate, while others prefer the liquidity of the **wholesale** trade. If a business deal goes wrong, getting a full **refund** is often a complex legal process that requires a lot of patience.

I love **imported** chocolate from Switzerland. I usually **subscribe** to a snack box every month. Yesterday, I had an **impulse** to buy a huge cake. Now my kitchen is full to the **brim** with sweets! I need to check my bank **transactions** to see how much I spent.

Online shopping makes it easy to **subscribe** to services we don't really need. I often feel an **impulse** to buy **imported** gadgets when I see them on social media. My history of bank **transactions** is long and messy. My room is now full to the **brim** with things I never use.

To avoid an **impulse** buy, I decided to **subscribe** to a financial blog for tips. I noticed that many of my **transactions** were for expensive **imported** coffee beans. My cupboard was full to the **brim**, so I decided to stop spending for a month to save some money.

The rise of e-commerce has led to a surge in international **transactions** for **imported** goods. Many consumers act on **impulse** when they **subscribe** to premium delivery services. As warehouses become full to the **brim** with stock, companies must find better ways to manage their supply chains and customer data.

My father works in a big **warehouse**. He has to **evaluate** the quality of every box. Some boxes contain **valuable** watches. He says the **proportion** of broken items is very low. Yesterday, a man came to give a **valuation** of the whole building.

It is difficult to **evaluate** the price of a house without a professional **valuation**. A large **warehouse** can hold many **valuable** items, so security is important. We noticed that the **proportion** of empty space in the building was increasing, so we decided to rent it out to another company.

The company sent a team to **evaluate** the stock in the main **warehouse**. They needed an accurate **valuation** of their most **valuable** assets before the merger. It turned out that a large **proportion** of their inventory was outdated and needed to be sold quickly at a discount.

Asset managers must constantly **evaluate** their portfolios to ensure they hold **valuable** securities. An expert **valuation** of a company's **warehouse** facilities can reveal hidden costs. There is often a direct **proportion** between the level of risk an investor takes and the potential reward they might receive.

The young entrepreneur **invested** his entire **wage** from his previous job into a new **enterprise** focused on **imported** luxury goods. He rented a small **warehouse** that was soon full to the **brim** with stock. However, he quickly realized that his **financial** planning had been flawed; he had acted on an **impulse** to buy too much at **wholesale** prices without a clear market **valuation**. To **evaluate** the situation, he had to look at his history of bank **transactions** and the **proportion** of returns. Many customers were demanding a **refund** because the quality wasn't as **valuable** as they expected. He decided to **subscribe** to a professional consulting service to help him save his business.

Scientists made a small **device** to study the moon. They could not **anticipate** the bad weather. At first, they thought the moon had a thick **atmosphere**, but that was **false**. Later, they **concluded** that it has very little air.

The team launched a specialized **device** into the high **atmosphere** to collect data. They didn't **anticipate** how strong the winds would be. After checking the results, they realized a **false** reading was caused by ice. Finally, they **concluded** that the data was still useful for the project.

It is difficult to **anticipate** the outcome of such a complex experiment. The researchers used a tracking **device** to monitor the chemical changes in the **atmosphere**. When a **false** alarm went off, they had to restart the test. After weeks of analysis, they **concluded** that the innovation was a success.

Environmentalists struggle to **anticipate** the long-term effects of pollution on the **atmosphere**. Every monitoring **device** must be calibrated to avoid a **false** positive. Once the investigation was finished, the board **concluded** that stricter laws were necessary to protect the planet's ecosystem.

My math teacher asked us to **calculate** the size of the room. It was a very **stuffy** classroom, so we opened the window. We **detected** a strange smell from the garden. Using **logic**, we found the source in our **surroundings**. It was just some old flowers.

The explorer tried to **calculate** his position using the stars. He **detected** a faint light in his **surroundings**. Following simple **logic**, he realized it was a small campfire. The air in the deep cave was **stuffy**, so he stayed near the entrance to breathe.

We need to **calculate** the risk before entering the **stuffy** laboratory. A specialized sensor **detected** a toxic gas in the immediate **surroundings**. It goes against all **logic** to stay in the building without a mask. Safety experts are now investigating the cause of the leak.

Data analysts use complex algorithms to **calculate** consumer behavior. They **detected** a pattern that defied conventional **logic**. Even in a **stuffy** office environment, they stayed focused on the details of their **surroundings**. Their findings will help the corporation integrate new marketing strategies.

I love **innovation** in toys. I have a **magnetic** robot. One day, the battery **exploded**! My mom sent an **inquiry** to the shop. They told us how to **integrate** a new safe battery into the toy.

The school project focused on a new **innovation** in energy. We tried to **integrate** a **magnetic** motor into a small car. Unfortunately, the motor **exploded** during the test run. After a long **inquiry**, we found out the wires were too thin for the power.

The factory introduced a major **innovation** to speed up production. They had to **integrate** a **magnetic** sorting system into the old assembly line. However, a steam pipe **exploded**, causing a delay. The government launched an **inquiry** into the safety of the new equipment.

The scientific community welcomed the **innovation** as a breakthrough. Engineers had to **integrate** advanced **magnetic** sensors into the spacecraft. When a prototype **exploded** on the runway, a detailed **inquiry** was conducted to determine the flaw in the design.

The research team spent months trying to **calculate** the probability of success for their new **innovation**. They used a highly sensitive **device** to measure the **magnetic** field in a **stuffy** laboratory. They didn't **anticipate** that the equipment would provide a **false** reading due to the local **surroundings**. When a boiler **exploded** nearby, the lab was filled with smoke, but a sensor **detected** the danger in time. Following an official **inquiry**, the scientists **concluded** that they must **integrate** better safety protocols and analyze the **atmosphere** more carefully to maintain their **logic**.

A **mysterious** cat appeared in our yard. I have a good **memory** for pets, but I did not know this one. I am very **observant**, so I noticed its red collar. We **proceeded** to call the owner. We used a ruler to **measure** how big the cat was.

The detective **proceeded** with the investigation into the **mysterious** disappearance of the painting. He was an **observant** man and found a tiny hair on the floor. He used his incredible **memory** to remember the faces of everyone in the building. He said that a person's worth is not something you can **measure** with money.

Archaeologists **proceeded** to dig deeper into the **mysterious** cave. Being **observant** researchers, they found ancient tools that were well-preserved. They had a shared **memory** of a similar site they visited years ago. They had to **measure** the exact location of every artifact they found.

The psychologist **proceeded** to explain the link between **memory** and emotion. She noted that an **observant** parent can often see a child's feelings before they speak. However, the complexity of the human mind remains a **mysterious** subject. It is difficult to find a proper **measure** for happiness in modern society.

The lake **reflects** the bright sun. I **resolved** to learn a new swimming **technique** this summer. I spent a high **percentage** of my time at the pool. Next week, I will join a **formal** swimming class.

He **resolved** to improve his English before the **formal** interview. He practiced a new reading **technique** every day. His test score **reflects** the hard work he put in. He now understands a large **percentage** of the articles he reads.

The company's success **reflects** the dedication of its staff. Management **resolved** to invest in a more advanced training **technique**. As a result, a higher **percentage** of projects are completed on time. They are now planning a **formal** dinner to celebrate their achievement.

Academic writing often **reflects** a student's ability to think critically. She **resolved** to master the **formal** style required for her thesis. She spent a significant **percentage** of her time researching a specific surgical **technique**. Her professors praised her clear and logical approach.

My brother is **naive**; he thought the moon was made of cheese. I **perceived** a tiny light moving in the sky. It was a **satellite** in its **orbit**. My dad says the company that made it has a **patent** for the technology.

The inventor applied for a **patent** for his new **satellite** design. He **perceived** a problem with how the device stayed in **orbit**. Some people were **naive** enough to think it would be easy to fix, but it took many months of hard work.

As the **satellite** entered its final **orbit**, the team **perceived** a small drop in communication. They hoped their **patent** would protect them from competitors copying their ideas. It would be **naive** to believe that other companies weren't watching their progress closely.

Intellectual property laws ensure that a **patent** holder has exclusive rights to their invention. The way a **satellite** maintains its **orbit** is a marvel of engineering. However, it is **naive** to think that global competition won't lead to disputes over what is **perceived** as a breakthrough.

The **observant** scientist **perceived** a **mysterious** signal coming from a **satellite** in **orbit** around Mars. She **resolved** to investigate the cause and **proceeded** with a series of tests. Her **memory** of a similar event helped her develop a new **technique** to analyze the data. It would be **naive** to ignore the signal, as it could be a major breakthrough. Her report **reflects** that a high **percentage** of the data was accurate. She later applied for a **patent** for her findings, which became the new **formal** **measure** of space communication success.

association.definition: Being together or connected with another person as a friend or partner.
association.example: Cathy feels greatly depressed because her parents are opposed to her association with the boy she loves.

alienated.definition: Feeling like you are not part of a group or family; feeling alone.
alienated.example: Parents often feel alienated from their children.

appointed.definition: To choose someone for a job or an important position.
appointed.example: Several years later, she was appointed sales manager.

campaign.definition: A plan with many steps to help someone win an election or sell a product.
campaign.example: Florida was a key state in his campaign for re-election.

chaotic.definition: Very messy and not in order; full of confusion.
chaotic.example: The traffic in Taipei was really chaotic before the completion of the MRT.

committee.definition: A group of people from a bigger group who meet to make decisions.
committee.example: The committee consists of twelve members.

combination.definition: Two or more different things that are put or mixed together.
combination.example: Maybe we can say that it's a combination of love and hatred.

controversial.definition: Causing many people to have strong arguments or disagreements.
controversial.example: Abortion is a highly controversial matter.

demanded.definition: To ask for something in a strong way.
demanded.example: The opposition parties have demanded that all the facts be made public.

democracy.definition: A way to run a country where the people choose their leaders by voting.
democracy.example: There is a need for more democracy in that country.

assure.definition: To tell someone that something is true so they do not worry.
assure.example: I assure you that you'll be able to make progress.

chaos.definition: A state of being very messy and having no order or control.
chaos.example: The failure of the electricity supplies created complete chaos in the city.

confine.definition: To keep something inside a certain area or on a certain topic.
confine.example: Please confine your remarks to the subject under discussion.

conception.definition: An idea or an understanding of what something is like.
conception.example: He's got a pretty strange conception of friendship.

combative.definition: Ready and wanting to fight or argue with people.
combative.example: He is famous as a combative spokesman for human rights.

headlines.definition: The title of a newspaper story printed in large letters.
headlines.example: The new road plan is in the headlines again.

harmony.definition: A state of living together peacefully.
harmony.example: Our cat and dog never fight they live together in perfect harmony.

imprisoned.definition: To put someone in a prison or a place they cannot leave.
imprisoned.example: The crew were imprisoned on the plane by hijackers.

consists.definition: To be based on or lie in something.

kidnappers.definition: People who take someone away by force to get money.
kidnappers.example: The boy's kidnappers demanded an enormous ransom.

military.definition: Relating to soldiers or the army.
military.example: The government has threatened to take military action.

cruelties.example: People all over the world are aware of the cruelties of war.

permissible.example: She has been exposed to radiation above the permissible level.

phenomenon.definition: A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen.
phenomenon.example: Scientists have studied this strange phenomenon for years.

designed.definition: To draw plans for how something will look or be made.
designed.example: The magnificent building was designed by a great architect.

contribution.definition: Something that you give or do to help something be successful.
contribution.example: He had made a very positive contribution to the company.

subjective.definition: Based on personal feelings rather than facts.
subjective.example: This is a very subjective judgment of her abilities.

token.definition: A thing that you give or do to show your feelings.
token.example: Please accept this small gift as a token of our gratitude.

fortify.definition: To make a place stronger against attack.
fortify.example: They built towers and walls to fortify this village.

reform.definition: To make changes in something to improve it.
reform.example: The union officials promised to reform working conditions.

dodge.definition: To avoid something unpleasant or difficult.
dodge.example: Somehow he managed to dodge all the difficult questions.

solve.definition: To find the answer to a problem.
solve.example: We are supposed to work together to solve this difficult problem.

spoil.definition: To ruin something or make it less good.
spoil.example: Let's not spoil it now by having a quarrel.

supervising.definition: To watch a person or activity to make sure that everything is done correctly.
supervising.example: She was busy supervising the cooking and the sewing.

territory.definition: An area of land that belongs to or is controlled.
territory.example: You're treading on rather dangerous territory if you mention that incident.

consulted.definition: To ask for information or advice from someone.
consulted.example: Why was I not consulted before you made the decision?

terror.definition: A feeling of being very frightened.
terror.example: She has a look of sheer terror on her face.

violence.definition: Behavior involving physical force intended to hurt.
violence.example: She cited several cases of domestic violence.

withstand.definition: To be strong enough not to be harmed.
withstand.example: The troops were too weak to withstand another attack.

justice.definition: Fairness in the way people are treated.
justice.example: To do him justice, we should look into the matter.

flourish.definition: To grow or develop well and be successful.
flourish.example: It's not easy for any business to flourish in the present economic situation.

justify.definition: To give a good reason for something.
justify.example: People ask the President to justify the new policy.

witness.definition: A person who sees an event happening.
witness.example: Evan was the most important witness to the accident.

scandal.definition: An action that causes public anger.
scandal.example: There has been no hint of scandal during his time in office.

current.definition: Belonging to the present time; happening now.
current.example: The current economic situation in this country is getting worse.

evaluate.definition: To judge or calculate the quality or value of something.
evaluate.example: It's difficult to evaluate her as a novelist.

budget.definition: A plan to show how much money is available and how it will be spent.
budget.example: The budget for building a new museum has been cut.

commission.definition: Payment made to someone who sells goods.
commission.example: The insurance agent earned a commission on every policy he sold.

fortune.definition: A large amount of money, goods, or property.
fortune.example: She won a fortune in the lottery.

financial.definition: Relating to money or how money is managed.
financial.example: It's a pity that their business got into financial difficulties.

collapsed.example: The company collapsed because of poor management.

currency.definition: The money that is used in a particular country.
currency.example: The British teachers in China were paid in local currency.

mission.definition: An important job or goal that someone is sent to do.
mission.example: It's really a difficult mission to accomplish.

credible.definition: Able to be believed or trusted.
credible.example: We all agree that it's a credible story.

competition.definition: When people try to be more successful than others.
competition.example: They believe that competition in business benefits the consumers.

code.definition: A set of rules that people are expected to follow.
code.example: As students, we are supposed to obey the code of the school.

contract.definition: A legal agreement between people or organizations.
contract.example: According to the terms of your contract, you must give notice.

cash.definition: Money in the form of notes and coins.
cash.example: They want cash only for this transaction.

financial.example: The company is facing a serious financial problem.

imported.definition: Brought into a country from another country.
imported.example: There is a rise in the number of imported luxury cars.

impulse.definition: A sudden strong wish to do something.
impulse.example: Mary's first impulse was to run.

refund.definition: An amount of money given back.
refund.example: She took the radio back and demanded a refund.

invested.definition: To put money into something for profit.
invested.example: He has invested all his money in antique furniture.

proportion.definition: Amount when compared to the whole.
proportion.example: The tax increases in proportion to the amount you earn.

subscribe.definition: To pay regularly for a service.

evaluate.example: The committee is going to evaluate the success of the program.

valuable.example: The burglar stole some valuable books.

wage.definition: A regular amount of money earned for work.
wage.example: He gives all of his wage packet to his wife.

warehouse.definition: A large building for storing goods.
warehouse.example: The shoe shop owner stored his goods in a warehouse.

transactions.definition: The act of buying or selling.
transactions.example: A record is kept of all the firm's transactions.

brim.definition: The top edge of a container.
brim.example: The glass is full to the brim.

wholesale.definition: Selling large amounts of goods to shops.
wholesale.example: They sell clothes for wholesale prices.

valuation.definition: A judgment of how much something is worth.
valuation.example: We asked an expert to make a valuation of the painting.

anticipate.definition: To imagine or expect that something will happen.
anticipate.example: It's impossible to anticipate when an earthquake will happen.

concluded.definition: To decide something after thinking carefully.
concluded.example: The inquiry concluded that the accident was caused by error.

atmosphere.definition: The mixture of gases around the Earth.
atmosphere.example: The space shuttle entered the Earth's atmosphere.

calculate.definition: To use numbers to find out an amount.

false.example: If you've made a false statement, you could be in trouble.

detected.example: I detected a change in her attitude.

device.definition: A piece of equipment made for a purpose.
device.example: It's a useful device for banging nails into walls.

surroundings.example: The house is situated in pleasant surroundings.

integrate.definition: To combine things into one whole.
integrate.example: It's difficult to integrate released prisoners back into society.

logic.example: There's no logic in spending money on things you don't need.

inquiry.definition: An official process to find out facts.
inquiry.example: In answer to your inquiry, the book is not in stock.

exploded.definition: To burst with a sudden loud noise.
exploded.example: Many people were injured when the boiler exploded.

innovation.example: What's next for innovation in this technology?

stuffy.example: The room is so stuffy that it is suffocating.

magnetic.definition: Having the power to attract metals.
magnetic.example: A compass becomes useless close to the magnetic North Pole.

measure.example: Wealth is not a proper measure of worth.

mysterious.definition: Strange and not easy to understand.
mysterious.example: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths.

memory.example: He has a good memory for names.

percentage.definition: Amount expressed as a number out of 100.
percentage.example: You pay a percentage of your income as tax.

formal.example: I haven't yet gotten a formal offer.

proceeded.example: After eating, we proceeded to the next town.

reflects.definition: To show an image or nature.
reflects.example: The lake reflects the trees on the shore.

resolved.definition: To decide firmly to do something.
resolved.example: She resolved that she would never speak to him again.

technique.definition: A way of doing something using skills.
technique.example: They admired the pianist's faultless technique.

observant.example: Luckily, an observant passerby noticed the fire.

perceived.example: He perceived a subtle change in her manner.

patent.example: Did you take out a patent on your design?

orbit.example: The spacecraft is in orbit around the moon.

satellite.definition: An object moving around a planet.
satellite.example: The broadcast came via the satellite.

naive.example: How can you be so naive?
